articles.title: Comprehensive Guide to Pregnancy Symptoms by Trimester

content.headline: Pregnancy Symptoms Through Each Trimester: What to Expect
content.intro: Pregnancy is a journey of continuous change, with different symptoms emerging as your baby grows and your body adapts. Understanding the typical progression of symptoms can help you prepare for each stage and know when to seek medical advice.

sections.title: First Trimester Symptoms (Weeks 1-12)
sections.content: The initial stage brings significant hormonal changes and early adaptation:
points: Tender, swollen breasts and darker areolas

sections.title: Second Trimester Symptoms (Weeks 13-28)
sections.content: Many early symptoms ease while new ones emerge:
points: Round ligament pain as uterus expands

sections.title: Third Trimester Symptoms (Weeks 29-40)
sections.content: Final stage as body prepares for delivery:
points: Shortness of breath as baby pushes diaphragm
Frequent urination returns with baby's position
Swelling in feet, ankles, and hands
Difficulty sleeping and finding comfortable positions

sections.title: When to Contact Your Healthcare Provider
points: Significant swelling in face or hands
Decreased fetal movement in third trimester
Fever over 38Â°C or signs of infection
Symptoms of preeclampsia (high blood pressure, protein in urine)
